title: fix: preserve aspect ratio in klein-9b dimension clamping
author: voodoohop

gist.headline: Breaking out of the box
gist.blurb: Klein-9b has learned that not everything needs to be a perfect square. Widescreen dreams are now a reality.
gist.summary: Updated the dimension clamping logic for the Klein-9b model to scale based on total pixel count rather than individual dimensions.
gist.impact: Users can now generate non-square images (portrait, landscape) with Klein-9b while maintaining the correct aspect ratio.
gist.visual_concept: A visual metaphor for changing aspect ratios: the bee mascot stretching a rigid square frame into a wide cinematic rectangle.
gist.image_prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of a cute 8-bit bee stretching a glowing digital picture frame from a square into a wide rectangle. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and pastel gradient background. Chunky retro sprites, warm lighting, lo-fi vibes like Stardew Valley. The frame shows a beautiful landscape. Nostalgic but beautiful, emotionally warm.

image.prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of a tiny 8-bit bee character stretching a digital picture frame from a square into a wide landscape shape. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and pastel gradient background. Chunky pixels, warm lighting, lo-fi aesthetic. Like Stardew Valley UI. Emotionally warm, nostalgic but beautiful.
